alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 9:33PM MDT until August 08 at 5:44AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Bankfull Stage. Minor innundation due to overbank flow possible. Nuisance flooding is possible in low lying areas downstream near the confluence of the Rio Ojo Caliente and the Rio Chama. At 7.0 feet, Farm and pasture land is being inundated, and irrigation channels and gates may be severely damaged. However, high flows are not expected to persist. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to near flood stage at 7.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage later tonight back to around 3.7 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued late tonight around 545 AM MDT.
